info.game_comments: 2005 Ultimate Tournament of Champions Round 1, game 10.

jeopardy_round: EAT IT, SPEND IT, OR WEAR IT

(1, 1).clue: There's Beth, Amy, Meg (I should give her a call)--all I'm missing from the "Little Women" is her

(3, 1).clue: He was one of Time's Men of the Year for 1993 along with F.W. De Klerk, Nelson Mandela & Yitzhak Rabin

(5, 1).clue: The only one of these that still remains is the Pyramids of Giza
(5, 1).correct response: the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World

(6, 1).clue: Federal post held by Ramsey Clark & Philander C. Knox

(1, 2).clue: This woman filed under "S" for her first name certainly likes the oloroso type of the wine of the same name

(2, 2).clue: "Golfer... 1st player to earn over $1 million in career (1968)... Made 48 consecutive Masters starts"

(3, 2).clue: This ancient dramatist is known for his innovative use of a second actor in his plays

(5, 2).clue: Can I get an amen for Pope Gregory, who thankfully reduced the list of these to 7

(6, 2).clue: This brazen biblical woman introduced the worship of Baal into Israel

(1, 3).clue: From the meaning of her name, it makes sense that this daughter of rabid "Gone with the Wind" fans always wore black

(2, 3).clue: "7-time NASCAR national champion... died in last lap crash at the 2001 Daytona 500"

(3, 3).clue: This famed fashion photographer passed away in October 2004

(5, 3).clue: Steve McQueen's "magnificent" movie was actually a remake of a film about 7 of these guys

(6, 3).clue: An unmarried young woman, especially on "The Dating Game"

(1, 4).clue: W is for this girl I once took to the Madison Avenue museum of the same name

(2, 4).clue: "Energized TV sports journalism with abrasive 'tell it like it is' style"

(3, 4).clue: After the 1994 midterm elections, this Texan became the first Republican House majority leader since the 1950s

(5, 4).clue: Tolkien should have consulted with the Brothers Grimm before having 13 of these accompany Bilbo in "The Hobbit"

(6, 4).clue: A "Paradise Lost" fallen angel, No. 2 to Satan

(1, 5).clue: Her Spanish name means "mercy", but she didn't show me any as she "drove" me crazy

(2, 5).clue: "Served 4 years for manslaughter... famous for... his catchphrase 'Only in America!'"

(3, 5).clue: "Revelations", based on African-American religious music, is this choreographer's masterpiece

(5, 5).clue: In "As You Like It" the speech that starts off "All the world's a stage" deals with these 7 periods

(6, 5).clue: This Pulitzer Prize winner penned "The Wapshot Scandal"

(1, 1).clue: Her marriage to Mel Leventhal produced Rebecca Walker, who produced the memoir "Black, White and Jewish"

(2, 1).clue: His album "The 12 Year Old Genius" topped the U.S. charts in 1963

(3, 1).clue: Lady Godiva was a naked babe in arms when this Scot & Shakespeare title character was on the throne

(4, 1).clue: This Louisiana state tree could use some Rogaine

(5, 1).clue: In 1859 tightrope walker Charles Blondin crossed this watery wonder many times; later he did it on stilts

(6, 1).clue: Financial support for a man's ex-wife

(1, 2).clue: Jean Toomer's "Cane" (1923) is one of the major works of this New York City movement

(2, 2).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew reports from Yellowstone Nat'l Park.)  The scenery gave Yellowstone this nickname, so it was fitting when Teddy Roosevelt's daughter  Alice visited the park

(3, 2).clue: In 1655 Cromwell suppressed a Royalist revolt & this Dutchman painted "The Slaughtered Ox"

(4, 2).clue: The strawberry is not a member of the berry family but is in fact a member of this garden flower family

(5, 2).clue: In 1828, thanks to his syllabary, the Cherokee Phoenix became the USA's first Indian language newspaper

(6, 2).clue: From the  Greek for "long-lasting", it's a long-term close friend

(2, 3).clue: In 2004 Brooke Shields was back on Broadway in the hit revival of this musical

(3, 3).clue: The only writing Bronte sister whose life overlapped Jane Austen's

(4, 3).clue: Andes Indians chew the leaves of this narcotic plant with lime juice for extra stamina

(5, 3).clue: Lincoln's election as captain of his company in this 1832 Indian war "gave me more pleasure than any I have had"

(6, 3).clue: Marked by an elegant or exclusive quality
